page.title: 07TREGONNING HILL (2)
page.content:
During this first period of settlement the lowland areas of Cornwall were still densely forested thus making any clear land such as Tregonning Hill more significant and of greater importance. Improved farming techniques, however, enabled lowland areas to be cleared making upland clear areas less important.
The second period occured from 1746 onwards when a Plymouth chemist called {William Cookworthy}was visiting the prosperous Great Work Tin Mine on the side of Tregonning Hill where a mine captain was his friend. He was taken to the hill top to be shown a new mine impliment and he noticed the miners making repairs with an odd clay. He realised its importance and the{china clay industry was established
